text: The patient was diagnosed with type 2 diabetes mellitus and started on metformin 500mg twice daily. Blood glucose levels improved significantly after 3 months of treatment.
MRI of the brain revealed a 2cm lesion in the left temporal lobe, suspicious for glioblastoma. The patient was referred to neurosurgery for biopsy.
Patient presents with fever, cough, and shortness of breath. COVID-19 PCR test positive. Chest X-ray shows bilateral pneumonia. Started on dexamethasone and supplemental oxygen.
Genetic testing revealed a pathogenic variant in the BRCA1 gene, conferring increased risk for breast and ovarian cancer. Prophylactic mastectomy was discussed.
The patient has a history of hypertension and hyperlipidemia, currently managed with lisinopril 10mg daily and atorvastatin 40mg at bedtime.
Blood culture grew Staphylococcus aureus. Patient started on vancomycin IV for suspected endocarditis. Echocardiogram ordered to evaluate cardiac valves.
The study found elevated levels of inflammatory cytokines including IL-6 and TNF-alpha in patients with rheumatoid arthritis compared to healthy controls.
Patient underwent laparoscopic cholecystectomy for symptomatic gallstones. Post-operative recovery was uncomplicated. Discharged on acetaminophen for pain management.
Lab results: hemoglobin 9.2 g/dL, WBC 12,500/μL, platelets 180,000/μL. Iron studies consistent with iron deficiency anemia. Started on ferrous sulfate 325mg daily.
The patient developed severe allergic reaction to penicillin, presenting with angioedema and urticaria. Treated with epinephrine 0.3mg IM and diphenhydramine 50mg IV.
